newsitem.title: GERMANY: DASA aims at ties to French defence firms.
newsitem.headline: DASA aims at ties to French defence firms.

text.p: Daimler-Benz Aerospace (DASA) is holding talks with French defence companies Matra and Alcatel aimed at possible future cooperation, a company spokesman said.
Matra and Alcatel are interested in taking stakes in Thomson-CSF, which is about to be privatised.
The DASA spokesman told Reuters talks were taking place, but said no conclusions had been reached.
"Nothing has been decided at all," he said.
The French government has said it will decide about the disposal of its 58 percent stake in Thomson by May 7.
The Daimler-Benz unit has already made clear its intention to unify more of the German defence industry under its stewardship.

DASA board member Werner Heinzmann has expressed interest in buying the defence electronics business of Siemens AG, and talks are also being held with Nuremberg-based Diehl about a takeover of its fuselage business.
DASA's defence and civil systems division, with 9,000 employees, had sales of 2.6 billion marks in 1996, and aims to boost sales to 2.8 billion marks this year.
